addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Robert Cecill Knight of her Hig
es
privie Councell.

13 Julij
1594
M
r
Bodley to my M
r

page.lettertext:
fol.33r
May it please yo
r
H. to be advertised,
at
e
inclosed to her
Ma
tie
was brought me this morning
by
e Greffier of
e
states:
and is an answear to
that letter, w
ch
her Ma
tie
writte unto them, and was
sent hither by yo
r
H. to be delivered by me. It con-
cerned
e abuse of their trafficque into
Spaine,
in transporting suche materials, as served
e
king
for
e furnishing of his navies. Wherein they doe ende-
vo
r
to satisfie her Hig
es
and their signifie their for-
wardnesse to assist her in
Brittaine.
The copie of
e l
re
I send yo
r
H. heerew
t
, having no other mater
to certifie besides, but
at w
ch
I writte but two daies
past unto my
L. T
re
r
: wherof I doe account
at
yo
r
H. is partaker. Onely this is written sins,
at
Co. Maurice
and
e
towne,
upon l
re
s and messages
sent too and fro, have resolved in a maner (for it
was
not
fully yet concluded
e 8 of this moneth) that
those of Groeninghen shall specifie by writing, upon w
at
conditions they will yelde, and then after from the
proposals. So that now e it doth appeere,
at they w
t
in
doe conceave, w
at
danger they incurre by delaieng
e
treatie, and therfor will not differ it, as all men ar
persuaded. For
e Count doth goe for ward w
t
his
galleries, and mines, and every way continueth his
former hostilitie. Heere is certaine intelligence
given to
e states,
at
e Enemie doth assemble about
Maestricht
, and useth all expedition for
e rescue of
Groeninghen. But by every mans conjecture before
they can be where they wold be,
e towne will be o
rs
by force or by faire meanes.
Wherew
t
I take my
humble leave. From
e Hage. July 13
Yo
r
H. at commaundem
t
Tho. Bodley
